result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeffrey Allen Meana
Current: W2902 Hwy 11, Elkhorn, WI 53121   (Effective: 06-17-2022)
Prior: W2902 Hy 11, Elkhorn, WI 53121

Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffrey Allen Meana in court. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Motion for Appointment of Counsel and Financial Disclosure Statement filed, granted by the court. Defendant sworn in, first payment 8-1-22. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Victim in court, requesting no contact to be lifted. DA objects and asks them to attend APFV. Motion to lift no contact by defendant, argument, granted. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDMENT 6-20-22: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH L.M.H. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH L.M.H. dob 11-19-1955 or RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Jeffrey A Meana in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Haggerman for defendant. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
